Detailed Description

This is a subclass of BasicController, implementing an abstract value controller.

Definition at line 13 of file LSTDQController.hh.

Policy *  policy,
double  tdDiscount 
)

Constructor. Set up additional vectors and matrices needed to implement natural actor critic.

Parameters:
actions the LSTDQCOntroller needs to know how many actions it has since the approximator doesn't know about actions in this case, only Q-values

void libpg::LSTDQController::accumulateGrad ( Vector &  reward,
Observation &  newObs 
) [virtual]

Used in batch mode only. Accumualtes a direction to change without doing a change in params. This is called instead of instantStep() to implement LSPI. RLAlgs like GPomdp and LineSearchAlg use this method.

Reimplemented from libpg::BasicController.

void libpg::LSTDQController::instantStep ( Vector &  reward  )  [virtual]

The assumption here is that the reward received is for the transition, i.e., the previous state, current state

void libpg::LSTDQController::delayedInstantStep ( double  reward,
int  steps 
) [virtual]

Do the work that instantStep() would normally do. This is called from getAction() This assumes rewards are independent of the transition and next state.

Parameters:
reward the last reward received (between the previous action and current action)
steps the number of steps done

void libpg::LSTDQController::batchStep (  )  [virtual]

Set the params to the new weights solution. Unlike the name implies, this is not a step. It's a new absolute solution. The name is reused to fit in with all the other controllers. Now just for batch mode, hence the reset
